Key Match Events: José Altuve scored from second on a bobbled throw by Lucas Erceg to tie the score
Jeremy Peña grounded into a force out at home
Dezenzo drew a walk to force in Diaz with the tiebreaking run
Mauricio Dubón followed with a single to left field to score Ben Gamel
Peña also scored on a fielding error by left fielder MJ Melendez
Post-Match Reflections: It’s been like that the whole year, we’ve been fighting
That’s a huge win for us, right there
We took advantage of an error, that’s what you have to do — when a good team makes a mistake, you have to take advantage of it
When Alex argues balls and strikes, 99% of the time, he’s right
Miscellaneous Highlights: Yainer Diaz hit a grounder to pitcher Lucas Erceg (2-5), who tried to barehand the comebacker, bobbled it and rushed a throw that got away from first baseman Vinnie Pasquantino. José Altuve scored from second on the play to tie the score
Pasquantino’s glove hand appeared to collide with Diaz, and he exited the game with an apparent injury
Ryan Pressly (1-3) pitched a scoreless eighth to earn the win after being activated from the 15-day injured list earlier in the day
Josh Hader pitched a perfect ninth to earn his 29th save of the season

Veteran outfielder Jason Heyward made a splash in his Astros debut. After being released by the Dodgers and signing with Houston earlier this week, Heyward had a two-run double down the right-field line off Royals starter Brady Singer in the bottom of the fifth inning to give Houston a 2-0 lead
Astros third baseman Alex Bregman was ejected in the fourth inning after appearing to complain about a strike-three call from home plate umpire Alex Tosi
Others: Royals shortstop Bobby Witt Jr., who leads the American League in hits, batting average and runs, went 0 for 4 after hitting safely in 16 of his previous 17 games
Royals RHP Seth Lugo (14-8, 3.19 ERA) will start against Astros LHP Framber Valdez (13-6, 3.27) on Friday
Trainer's room updates for both teams
